TopicTitle: What's Your Favorite Body In The Solar System?:

Articles.Content:
I was just wondering what's your favorite planet, dwarf planet; and why?

My favorite planet is Uranus, because it's a lovely blue and always left out. My favorite dwarf planet is Pluto with that lovely red patch, and it loves you (heart crater).
(My favorite moon is Enceladus, just beautiful, and covered in ice.)

Whats yours?

Edited August 7, 2017 by Xemina
Mine is Saturn (Rings), and dwarf planet, Ceres (Water, possibly the reason life exists on Earth).

My favorite body is my own. I'm hot, yo!  

 

Nah, just kidding (both sentences, really ). The moon, 'cause it's right there and it's so damn beautiful.

My favorite is Earth because without it nothing we know or ourselves would exist!  

*Including the concepts of planets and their names

Edited August 7, 2017 by Spacetraindriver

This is my favorite planet - Neptune. There are many reasons why, but for one, I love the deep blue colors.

My favorite moons, besides our own, is a tie between Io (center picture) and Europa (right picture). The problem is that there are so many things of interest in our solar system... it is kinda hard for me to choose just one. I had hoped that by now, in my lifetime, we would be beyond the Moon when it comes to a human presence in space. The International Space Station is an insult to humanity when it comes to what should have happened after both the Apollo and Soyuz missions...

Earth has Pizza. And chocolate.

As for dwarf planets, Ceres, because it's the closest and probably the only one that could have any strategic value in the next few centuries.
Mine is not up there. It is the centaur Charkilo. It has very interesting rings.

Basically all of them are cool. Though Jupiter and its moons are some of the coolest. Imagine if Mars and Venus appeared in our sky at more than the Moon's angular size? That's basically the Galilean moons. From Europa, Jupiter is ~12 degrees wide, 24 times the angular size of our Moon. Both Io and Ganymede would be less than a degree, but nonetheless larger than the Moon's apparent size. Callisto would be about half as wide as our Moon. All at closest approach, and all of these are approximate. Really neat stuff.
When a new exoplanet discovery is announced, no one asks, "But how Venus-like is it?" We're happy to learn about more kinds of planets, but we're hoping to find one particular kind of place.
Earth. Why? In one word: life.
Pluto. Why? Why not.
Earth. I don't think I could live anywhere else.
Earth, because they have KSP there.
Charon kinda looks cool i guess

Personally I like all the planets, but Neptune has always mystified me. I really love neptune's cerulean atmosphere with wisps of white it looks kind of calming just staring at it kind of like a lava lamp only instead of weird goo inside a flask suspended in coloured water its various gases interacting with the vacuum of space.  

Edited August 16, 2017 by Jeb1969

*Resists urge to click on Uranus for comical purposes*

My favorite moon is Europa. Yeah, I'm biased by Odyssey Two, but whatever.

EDIT: Really? No Venus? But it's only a hole of ugly death! And, uh, I notice Pluto is under dwarf planets...

Oh yes. I just did the forbidden thing. Enjoy it as the forum collapses into anarchy and chaos.

...And I support that decision!

Edited August 17, 2017 by Confused Scientist
Enjoy the eclipse!
Odette Annable, but I guess that's not what you were asking.....

I always liked the gas giants, specially Saturn and Jupiter for its colors, mass and very interesting moons, my favourite moons are The Moon because of its grey colors and because it has some water, also I always loved to watch it sometimes at night, my second favourite moon is probably Phobos because the Stickney crater makes it look like a big orbital cannon like the Death Star from Star Wars. I like dwarf planets a little, the one I like the most for now It's Eris because it is very very away from our planet.
Favorite planet is Earth, because y'know, life, and my favorite moon is... well, the Moon. It's gray, almost metallic look really does look great.
Favorite object: Titan for sure, because you can fly there with wings attached to your arms, an oxygen mask, and a super warm coat.
Neptune, though Venus is a close second. Maybe if Maxwell Montes was 55 km high (habitable region of Venus atmosphere) instead of that boring only slightly cooler than sea level 11 km. Like cmon.
My favorite planet is definitely Jupiter, that planet and it's moons are amazing!
Why are there no moons in the poll? (Of course I understand that you can‘t add every single moon that exists in our solar system due to their number, but I‘m talking about the big ones)

Mimas. Because that's no moon.

Spoiler

Uranus. Because rings
